snippet: Seven Yonkers men charged with carrying out part of a $45 million theft executed internationally did not stand out until they started to flaunt Rolex watches and luxury cars.
abstract: Seven Yonkers men now charged with participating in $45 million bank teller theft executed internationally did not stand out until they started to flaunt Rolex watches and luxury cars; despite sophistication of the crime, accused seemed genuinely awe-struck by their good fortune and their eagerness to flash their profits helped lead to their arrests; Elvis Rafael Rodriguez, one of those indicted, pleads not guilty.

byline.contributor: Ezra Fieser contributed reporting from the Dominican Republic, and Randy Leonard and Christopher Maag from Yonkers. Alain Delaquérière and Jack Styczynski contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Seven Yonkers men charged with carrying out part of a $45 million theft executed internationally did not stand out until they started to flaunt Rolex watches and luxury cars.

headline.seo: A.T.M. Robbery Suspects May Have Caused Own Undoing
headline.main: In A.T.M. Robbery Case, a Splashy Trail of Big Spending
headline.print_headline: In A.T.M. Case, A Splashy Trail Of Big Spending
